posts.name: Zack Ts
posts.cooked:
Hi all,
sometimes my daughter gets my mobile in her hands to chat via my Signal account.

That is okay by me, since she uses primarily our family group chat. However, since I use Signal intensively, there are different conversations of different personal level.

So I would like to be able to lock certain conversations from being opened by somebody else.

Archiving private conversations is my solution to get them a out of sight. However, a good old password would be the better solution to lock personal information weithin Signal.

I think for this there are other Use-Cases, too.

Greets
Z.

link_counts.title: Chat Lock: Making your most intimate conversations even more private
Chat Lock: Making your most intimate conversations even more private

posts.name: Will Skelton
posts.cooked:
I‚Äôm not sure what else to call this. I want to be able to move a chat or a group to a space that‚Äôs like the archived section but hidden behind a numeric pin. In addition, it would also be really cool to have the option for multiple pins that can be used to ‚Äúshow‚Äù fake messages or emergency pins that show fake messages and send silent messages elsewhere in the event that someone was demanding a pin. That way, if someone threatens you to give them your pin, you can give them a fake one and it looks like it worked.

A few examples I personally know of are teenagers who need to communicate with CPS or people trying to escape abusive partners that run the risk of getting their phones searched.

posts.name: Purba
posts.cooked:
We are all aware that the signal is safe and secret.
The vast majority of us utilize signal to safeguard our privacy.
For Regula SMS and encrypted Signal message, I use the Signal app.
I‚Äôve enabled the app‚Äôs screen lock.
But, to be honest, I‚Äôve never seen a stranger app lock mechanism than this one.

  1. When you touch the lock button it will automatically lock apps too.
    I‚Äôm not sure why Signal lacks this feature?

    pic01080√ó610 40.7 KB

  2. Instead of showing ‚ÄúLock Signal‚Äù on the notification panel all the time.

    pic11080√ó830 125 KB

how about an app lock button on top? similar to this?

pic21024√ó752 66.1 KB

  1. Why can‚Äôt I unlock the apps with a password or a pin instead of biomatric?

The main feature : Ability to lock individual chats.

Every day, I get 20/40 SMS and hundreds of signal messages.
Signal has the only one option. lock apps entirely with biomatric.
As it is now, I must use my finger print every time I receive a message.
Not every message need the same level of security as a nuclear code.
It‚Äôs not much pleasure to utilize biomatric just to see Grandma‚Äôs good morning message.
It irritates me.
Every week, my office sends around 2/3 signal message.
It would be fantastic if I could just lock my office conversations with a pin or password.
This functionality is available in many other IM applications, including WhatsApp and Threema.

posts.name: üëäüá∫üá∏üî•
posts.cooked:
purba:

Why can‚Äôt I unlock the apps with a password or a pin instead of biomatric?

Signal uses the Android keystore for app lock which is bound to whatever your lock screen unlock method is. If you change it to password, then the app lock will require a password.

But if someone has your lock screen password, the app lock doesn‚Äôt matter much so, as with all things computing security, it comes down to the user to be knowledgeable enough to use a strong password or choose the correct type of security (password or biometric) in accordance with their threat model as the last line of defense.

I‚Äôm curious how others would gauge the option of a ‚ÄúSecret‚Äù Chat List, only visible when the correct PIN/code is entered into the search bar.

Use case: sharing one‚Äôs phone with family or friends, a user might see (and perhaps) read John Doe in default Chat List but it would not be evident (without knowing/guessing the PIN/code or being told) that there exists a hidden ‚Äúsecret‚Äù John Doe chat.

  • No notifications are allowed for messages delivered to the Secret Chat List - user has to open the Secret Chat List to see any new messages.
  • A button always visible that by clicking will close the Signal app immediately.
  • Messages are deleted/disappear automatically after two weeks. This is an app setting not customizable.
  • A single contact could have a chat thread in both the Secret Chat List and the default Chat List.
  • This feature is enabled by the user entering (configuring) a code into a Settings field that displays the text ‚ÄúShhhhh‚Äù and then the text disappears after leaving Settings.
    • The code can only be changed by entering the correct code into the Settings field.
    • Entering the incorrect code (assuming the code is already set) the user receives the same text ‚ÄúShhhhh‚Äù but if that code is entered into the Search bar the user receives a ‚ÄúNo Chat‚Äôs Available‚Äù message (it assumed that in the time between the user setting the code and then entering it, that the true owner of the app has not changed the code).

The risks involved are:

  • Forgetting the enable code
  • Unintended display of the Secrets Chat List to another person
  • Someone else guessing or inadvertently entering the code into the search bar
  • Someone else setting the enable code before the user does

Let me know what you think in the comments.

posts.name: Whatnoww
posts.cooked: Privacy from who? Not WhatsApp that‚Äôs for sure, and from a serious attacker. They should stop calling convenience features privacy features.

posts.name: Fabian
posts.cooked:
So I will just gather some thoughts about this in this post and I am open for any feedback.

First of all I think it would be helpful if the code to lock the complete signal app on iOS wouldn‚Äôt be the same as the one to unlock the whole phone. If someone‚Äôs cracks or knows the phones password this layer of security is automatically useless.

Second, it would be nice if this was adjustable to the users personal needs. Do you just want to keep people from reading the message? Then it should be possible to allow push notifications etc. from this chat. Do you want this to be completely invisible? Don‚Äôt show push notifications on the Lock Screen or anywhere.

Third, I personally wouldn‚Äôt like my chats moved into an extra folder. At least not all of them, so again this should be adjustable to the users needs.

All in all, this would be very useful and I am looking forward to hear others opinion on this.

posts.name: Ajay Kumar
posts.cooked:
The Signal app should have a feature similar to WhatsApp but with better options for locking and hiding chats. This feature could allow users to press and hold on Signal name to open them.

posts.name: Pickle
posts.cooked:
ZackTS:

So I would like to be able to lock certain conversations from being opened by somebody else.

I‚Äôve never personally felt the need for this feature, but I think it makes perfect sense. I think a simple and elegant way to implement this would be similar to how Bitwarden has an option to ‚Äúre-prompt‚Äù for your master password that you can enable for specific entries. ‚úÖ Require master password "re-prompt" for some items - Password Manager - Bitwarden Community Forums

Maybe Signal can add an option to re-prompt you for your pin before accessing specific chats. I think that would work nicely.

link_counts.title: ‚úÖ Require master password "re-prompt" for some items - Password Manager - Bitwarden Community Forums

posts.cooked: I‚Äôd prefer to have the option of the device lock, pin or pw for each chat. Perhaps this is a enhancement that will be added to the new Folders feature.

posts.name: Anon
posts.cooked:
If it‚Äôs too much to ask for, for each chat. I would love to at least have a secret chat option that is password protected. Putting in the password for that will open up all the protected chats.
And lastly, I‚Äôll add on there that hopefully the password will be totally customizable.

If Signal incorporates these features they‚Äôll prob start stealing users from other private messaging apps.
